data.question: What is the chemical formula of the cluster used as the building block for assembly of 2D CPs I and II?
What method was used for the synthesis of MolybdenumII isonicotinate cluster (A)?
data.answer: A solution of Mo2(acetate)4 and isonicotinic acid in anhydrous DMF was refluxed at 120 °C for two days.

data.question: What is the role of DABCO in the crystallization process of II?
data.answer: DABCO facilitates improved crystalline ordering and alternate interplanar spacing between 2D lattices.

data.question: Is DABCO incorporated into the crystal structure of II?
What is the BET surface area calculated from the CO2 adsorption isotherm of I?
What type of isotherm is observed for N2 adsorption on I?
What is the standard heterogeneous electron transfer rate constant (ks) for the [Mo2(INA)4]0/–1 couple?
Does the crystal structure of I remain intact after BET analysis?
What is the temperature stability range of I before decomposition begins?
What is the main feature observed in the CO2 adsorption isotherm of I?
data.answer: Three distinct regions suggesting a Type VI isotherm

data.question: Is the redox behavior of I stable over multiple CV scans?
What is the main difference in the crystal packing of I and II when viewed down the c axis?
data.answer: II shows a flatter structure for the 2D lattices and increased ordering of the DMA solvent molecules.

data.question: What is the role of DMA in the assembly of CPs I and II?
data.answer: DMA acts as a solvent in the recrystallization process.

data.question: Does the presence of DABCO affect the crystal structure of II compared to I?
What is the significance of the Mo-Mo bond distances in I and II?
data.answer: They are within 2% of the Mo-Mo bond distances observed in quadruply bonded Mo2 cores coordinated by 3-atom bridging ligands.

data.question: What is the main characteristic of the CO2 adsorption isotherm of I?
data.answer: It exhibits unique CO2 adsorption nominally Type VI for an isotherm collected at 195 K.

data.question: Is the hierarchical pore structure of the material mentioned in the text significant for its CO2 adsorption properties?
What is the quasi-reversible feature identified in the cyclic voltammetry of I?
data.answer: A quasi-reversible feature at E1/2 = −1.275 V versus ferrocene/ferrocenium ascribed to the [Mo2(INA)4]0/–1 redox couple.

data.question: What is the main advantage of incorporating redox tunable states in CPs?
data.answer: It engenders a responsive framework with functional properties.

data.question: Is the Mo2(INA)4 cluster redox-active?
